channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Mart√≠nez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Jeffrey Epstein co-conspirator Ghislaine Maxwell to testify before Congress
item.description: Jeffrey Epstein co-conspirator Ghislaine Maxwell will sit Monday for closed-door, virtual testimony with lawmakers on the Republican-led House Oversight Committee.
item.content:encoded: Jeffrey Epstein co-conspirator Ghislaine Maxwell will sit Monday for closed-door, virtual testimony with lawmakers on the Republican-led House Oversight Committee.
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: Rep. Raja Krishnamoorthi, D-Ill., talks abut the deposition of Ghislaine Maxwell
item.description: NPR's Leila Fadel talks to House Oversight Committee member Rep. Raja Krishnamoorthi, D-Ill., about the deposition Jeffrey Epstein accomplice, Ghislaine Maxwell.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Leila Fadel talks to House Oversight Committee member Rep. Raja Krishnamoorthi, D-Ill., about the deposition Jeffrey Epstein accomplice, Ghislaine Maxwell.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Japan's ruling party wins a supermajority in country's lower house
item.description: Japan's ruling party scored its biggest electoral win in its seven-decade history Sunday, due mostly to the popularity of its first female prime minister, Sanae Takaichi.
item.content:encoded: Japan's ruling party scored its biggest electoral win in its seven-decade history Sunday, due mostly to the popularity of its first female prime minister, Sanae Takaichi.
item.dc:creator: Anthony Kuhn

item.title: Need a new path in midlife? There's a school for that and a quiz to kickstart it
item.description: Schools across the country are offering courses and retreats for people 50+ who want to reinvent themselves and embrace lifelong learning and discovery.
item.content:encoded:
Schools across the country are offering courses and retreats for people 50+ who want to reinvent themselves and embrace lifelong learning and discovery.

(Image credit: Allison Aubrey)
item.dc:creator: Allison Aubrey

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: The search for Nancy Guthrie enters its second week, Ghislaine Maxwell to testify before Congress Monday, the Seahawks pummel the Patriots, taking home Super Bowl LX title.
item.content:encoded: The search for Nancy Guthrie enters its second week, Ghislaine Maxwell to testify before Congress Monday, the Seahawks pummel the Patriots, taking home Super Bowl LX title.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: 'The People Can Fly' examines the challenges African-American prodigies have faced
item.description: MIT professor and author Joshua Bennett speaks with NPR's Michel Martin about his new memoir and cultural history book, "The People Can Fly: American Promise, Black Prodigies, and the Greatest Miracle of All Time."
item.content:encoded: MIT professor and author Joshua Bennett speaks with NPR's Michel Martin about his new memoir and cultural history book, "The People Can Fly: American Promise, Black Prodigies, and the Greatest Miracle of All Time."
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: Ukrainian president says US set June deadline for Russia and Ukraine to end war
item.description: Ukraine's President Zelenskyy said the U.S. has set a June deadline for Kyiv and Moscow to end the war, even as Washington and Russia discuss $12 trillion in economic deals that could affect Ukraine.
item.content:encoded: Ukraine's President Zelenskyy said the U.S. has set a June deadline for Kyiv and Moscow to end the war, even as Washington and Russia discuss $12 trillion in economic deals that could affect Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Beardsley

item.title: US scientists adapt after the Trump administration's funding blows
item.description: Scientists say the Trump administration's policies have led to major changes and uncertainty about scientific efforts and accomplishments.
item.content:encoded: Scientists say the Trump administration's policies have led to major changes and uncertainty about scientific efforts and accomplishments.
item.dc:creator: Kate Grumke

item.title: Hong Kong media tycoon Jimmy Lai sentenced to 20 years in prison
item.description: A Hong Kong court sentenced 78-year-old activist and publisher Jimmy Lai to 20 years in prison after finding him guilty under China's national security law.
item.content:encoded: A Hong Kong court sentenced 78-year-old activist and publisher Jimmy Lai to 20 years in prison after finding him guilty under China's national security law.
item.dc:creator: Emily Feng

item.title: Seahawks win Super Bowl, beating the Patriots 29-13
item.description: The Seattle Seahawks dominated the New England Patriots to win Super Bowl LX. We head to Santa Clara, California, to discuss the NFL championship game.
item.content:encoded: The Seattle Seahawks dominated the New England Patriots to win Super Bowl LX. We head to Santa Clara, California, to discuss the NFL championship game.
item.dc:creator: Steve Futterman
